page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN HANDCROSS
page.content: In Handcross many people own cars.The road from London to Brighton is called the A.23.It is very busy on the A.23.On a week day between 8.40am and 9.10am we counted 903 vehicles going north and 607 vehicles going south.The council are planning to straighten it out and widen it.Gatwick is the nearest airport,14 million people come to Gatwick a year.The most popular airline is British Caledonion.The closest railway to Handcross is in Crawley.The trains go to London or the coast.Some people prefer to ride bicycles or motorbikes.Some buses go through Handcross to take people to work and children to school.The buses go from Handcross to London,Handcross to Crawley and Handcross to Burgess Hill.
